website_summaries.verdict: The Ricoh GR II is a modest update to many a photographer's favorite pocket camera, adding Wi-Fi and a few firmware tweaks.
cons: Wi-Fi implementation can use some improvement

customer_reviews.title: Destroys Smartphone Cameras
customer_reviews.text: To the reviewer who compared this camera to a smartphone mentioning megapixels and number of lenses - you forgot the single most significant difference between this camera and any smartphone camera - the sensor - which is about 8 times the size of the one in your smartphone! This camera is capable of taking absolutely superb professional grade photos. The lens is also one of the sharpest you can find on any camera or amongst any prime lens. Combine all of this with a leaf shutter and tiny proportions of the camera as a whole and you have something that leaves any smartphone camera in the dust.
customer_reviews.author: Phil S.

customer_reviews.title: Really small but really comfortable to hold
customer_reviews.text: Really small but really comfortable to hold. 28mm eqv. takes a little getting used to; not super-wide, but a noticeable jump from 35mm. DNG raw files are easy to work with but don't have huge range for recoving shadows or pulling back highlights. B&W output is excellent. A lovely tool to carry in a pocket and extremely quick and satisfying in hand.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little street photography camera
customer_reviews.text: This anonymous looking camera is capable of take very sharp images.It has some excellent focus features and deserves its reputation as an amazing camera for street photography
customer_reviews.author: Clifton.D

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic street photography camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little camera for anyone interested in street photography. Control's are easy to use and after a little practice, can be used with one hand. Really good for incognito shots on the street. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: complete for the street
customer_reviews.text: Complete package. Don't forget to occasionally update the firmware. best street camera out there
customer_reviews.author: ushiec

customer_reviews.title: Great little Camera to bring everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera which complements a DSLR, etc nicely. Really compact and light. Picture quality is excellent and the camera has enough resolution in my opinion. It's very discrete, great for street photography and one can get closer if the wide angle lens is not enough for the subject. It also has a decent macro mode. Couldn't be happier with this camera!
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Had GR1 and loved it. Perfect for street photography. Ive used many cameras for street work and none come close to GR.
customer_reviews.author: steve evans

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: You will not regret buying this peice of kit. Great for many types of photography not just a street machine.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Perfection, still stands true in 2019-2020
customer_reviews.text: This camera is the perfect pick up and go Machine. Perfect for anyone looking to transition between 35mm shooting and digital. The freedom you get from “lack of a view finder is amazing. Just an all round outstanding camera if you’re looking to step up your social media game, or create a little zine.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Morgan

customer_reviews.title: My favourite compact everyday go anywhere anytime camera
customer_reviews.text: Great image quality for size of camera, truly pocket friendly. Very quick and easy to use , lots of ways to customise to your liking. Very sharp and relatively distortion free 28mm lens ( full frame equivalent) super jpegs + RAW dng ... so much to like ;)
customer_reviews.author: terryharris

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected. Great pictures. Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Qian

customer_reviews.title: Great little beauty
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this camera a few months but so far I absolutely love it. The lens is sharp , the autofocus is fast , the controls are well placed and the images it produces are excellent. Ok so like everyone else I have heard about the issues with dust so I keep it in a case and hope all is good. All in all a great camera but I did get it at nearly half price on here two so doubly good.
customer_reviews.author: Citizen Smith

customer_reviews.title: Pint Sized Wonder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera on an Amazon deal for a good price. I was going to buy the more expensive Fujifilm X70 but I love the money I saved! I carry this pint sized wonder with me most days and have not regretted my purchase. The only negative that I can come up with is the lack of a tilting screen.
customer_reviews.author: G J Haskett

customer_reviews.title: Quite unique.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant - had the original GR and sold it. Its not until i ordered the GRii that i realised how great these are. Quite unique, super slim and APSC size sensor.
customer_reviews.author: Mr C J Fry

customer_reviews.title: this camera has a ton of features and has options ...
customer_reviews.text: this camera has a ton of features and has options for everything but it's almost bogged down with options which makes it extremely fiddly to use.
customer_reviews.author: elliott

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: As a Leica Q owner , I bought the Ricoh as back up. I hate to admit it, but I prefer the Ricoh for street shooting. It is simply a superb handling, discreet (looks like a toy; really isn't though) street camera. If you enjoy street photography, you NEED a Ricoh GR!
customer_reviews.author: undertaker

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best of many digital cameras I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Superb camera. Probably the best of many digital cameras I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: If I could have its babies I would. But, it's turned down my advances so far. Seriously all the online reviews will convince you of its awesomeness, perfect little pocketable camera. I'm just here to say I love it.
customer_reviews.author: James Macmillan

customer_reviews.title: I have to say ashes are really easy into this camera and attach to the sensor
customer_reviews.text: I have to say ashes are really easy into this camera and attach to the sensor, I bought it for 4 days and I have seen there is a small spot when I open the aperture to 16. But it doesn't matter to me because I'm rarely using so small aperture, and it can be cleaned. Beside this, I think this is a perfect DC, it has the best operation, small body to put in pockets, and good quality because of the aps-c sensor! If you are familiar with Pentax's DSLRs, I guess you will quickly get started.

customer_reviews.title: ... older GR model at £200 cheaper - otherwise a fine camera
customer_reviews.text: Did not see any significant benefit over older GR model at £200 cheaper - otherwise a fine camera
customer_reviews.author: iP4

customer_reviews.title: Why the quality so poor! ! ! Is it real new one ? Or just refurbish ?
customer_reviews.text: Just 2 months ! It stuck !!! One time I took a photo then the screen stuck! And I can not shutdown! I only took the battery out ! i had a video about it . I record it !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not all that
customer_reviews.text: Not as great as I had read. The camera is ok, it’s the lens that’s the problem for me. 28mm is way to wide for every day shooting and the crop mode is a waste of time as it degrades the picture quality. The camera build and lay out are great. I just wish they had made a 50mm equivilant version.
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: GRII love this gem of a compact camera
customer_reviews.text: I know the GRIII is out but spotted a deal on GRII and took the plunge knowing the Ricoh system very well. With the built in flash on board and pocketable I'd recommend whilst I save up for the GRIII but at near half the price I ain't in a great hurry as I get great results using this beast around streets and family for those candid moments where my DSLR puts people off and is often too heavy to lug about
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. A. Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Brother you’re gonna carry that load a long time
customer_reviews.text: Am I missing something here, my Huawei P20 Pro Smartphone has a Leica Camera capable of taking 40mpx RAW images and all the controls that a professional photographer desires, it’s got 125gbt hard drive, fits in my pocket and provides everything I seek for a complete digital life. It leaves this camera as unwanted baggage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You need to be able to position yourself to get the best photo's but the quality is impressive
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I'm really impressed with the quality and ease of use of this camera. You need to be able to position yourself to get the best photo's but the quality is impressive. I would highly recommend for street photography or for every day use. You can carry it in your pockets and I find this to be its main USP
customer_reviews.author: chris_w

product_meta.title: Ricoh GR II Compact System Camera, Black (16MP, 18.3 mm Wide Lens, F2.8, WiFi) 3-Inch LCD
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Camera OnlyThis new model combines compact dimensions - perfect for snapshot photography on the street - with high-quality, high-resolution images delivered by a large image sensor, equal in size to the one installed on PENTAX digital SLR cameras. It also provides a range of smartphone-support functions, including wireless image transfer and remote shooting.Developed as the next generation of our highly acclaimed GR series, the GR II inherits the product concept of the GR series: a perfect balance between exceptional image quality and outstanding portability. It is also the first GR-series model to feature Wi-Fi and NFC (Near Field Communication) functions for easy pairing with smartphones and other mobile devices. It provides outstanding basic specifications, including: a high-performance lens, acclaimed to be the best in GR history; a large, APS-C-size CMOS image sensor; the high-performance GR ENGINE V imaging engine. Its imaging power has been further upgraded by reprogramming the white-balance algorithm to improve the precision of AWB (Auto White Balance) control and fine-tuning the compensation program to prevent high-sensitivity noise. It is designed to accommodate a wider variety of scenes and subjects by adding new creative tools, such as six effect modes and a wireless flash discharge function in combination with an external flash unit.

BOX CONTAINS
Ricoh GR II Digital Camera, Rechargeable Lithium-Ion Battery (DB-65), USB Power Adaptor, USB Cable, Software CD-ROM, Hand Strap, Hot Shoe Cover
feature_bullets: 16.2 MP APS-C CMOS sensor. Focus Modes-Multi AF, Spot AF, Pinpoint AF,Subject tracking AF, MF,Snap, Infinity, Face detection priority AF (in Auto shooting mode / when Portrait of Effect is set), Continuous AF, Full Press Snap
High-performance GR ENGINE V; effective range is 0.2 to 3.0 m
High-performing GR Lens eq. to 28 mm F2.8 (two aspherical elements)
Built in Wi-Fi and NFC Module for image transferring and sharing
Ricoh GR II Camera Black 16MP, 3 Inch LCD; FHD: 18.3 mm; wide lens: F2.8; WiFi rechargeable battery: DB-65 - 174584USB; power adapter USB cable software (CD-Rom); hand strap hot shoe cover

specifications.Included Components: Ricoh GR II Digital Camera, Rechargeable Lithium-Ion Battery
specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK
